job_title: Spring/Summer 2026 PhD Agent Task Planning for Resource-Constrained Client Devices Co-op
job_city: San Jose  San Jose, California US
job_description:
• You will gain experience in building efficient LLM systems, optimizing for edge environments, and contributing to scalable AI agent architectures.
• You have strong programming skills, preferably in Python, and experience building and testing AI prototypes.
• You have prior experience with AI agent task planning through coursework, research, or projects.
• Location: San Jose, CA, USOnsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time (40 hours a week), either in a hybrid or onsite or remote work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
• We will involve you in developing a task planning framework powered by Large Language Models, designed to operate effectively on client devices with limited resources.
• We will assign you the task of building and refining a focused prototype that demonstrates a practical use case, such as computer tasks, browser interactions, or database reasoning.
• Your responsibility will include extending the capabilities of constrained LLMs through context condensation, fine-tuning, and Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA).
• We will train you to collaborate with AMD AI teams to help bring your developed techniques into practical, real-world deployments.

job_title: Intern, Systems Engineering - Compute AI Hardware Platforms
job_description:
• In this role, you’ll get hands-on experience designing, testing, and analyzing the hardware and software that make next-generation computing possible.
• Along the way, you’ll be supported by experienced mentors who will help guide your technical and professional growth.
• Are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD or equivalent experience program in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a closely related field.
• Experience with hands-on lab testing, performing measurements with power meters, oscilloscopes or logic analyzers.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in understanding how hardware and systems work.
• Experience in at least one programming or scripting language (such as Python, C/C++, or MATLAB) Good teamwork and communication skills, with a willingness to collaborate across fields.
• Working on interesting new projects with leaders in the field is exciting, but we also know how important it is to receive support.
• That's why throughout your internship, you can expect regular feedback and development opportunities, social activities to connect with your peers, an end of internship celebration, plus the opportunity to be *considered for future Graduate positions (*subject to performance).
